bibl.title: J.W. Tripp v. Territory of Washington. Order granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Jefferson County Third Judicial District Court

p.del: In the County Court of the

body.p: Territory of Washington COUNTY OF Jefferson State of 3rd judicial District
In the matter of the application of } Order granting Writ. J.W. Tripp for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Upon reading and filing the petition of J.W. Tripp duly signed and verified by him whereby it appears that he may be or is illegaly imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by John H. Woodly, Sheriff of the County of Jefferson W.T. at the jail in the siad County of Jefferson in the State of _____ and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas of Corpus ought to issue.

It is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the County Court of the ____ County of ____ State of ____ directed to the said John H. Woodly, Sheriff commanding him to have the body of said J.W. Tripp before me, in the Court Room of the said Court, on the Fourth day of June A.D. 1867, at 12 o'clock a.m. of that day, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the siad J.W. Tripp --- together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there the said writ.

p.del: Judge of the County Court of the County of

body.p: Charles Beu Darwin Judge for Judicial District W.T.
In the matter of the application of J.W. Tripp for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Order granting Writ.
Filed June 4 A.D. 1867 James Seavey Deputy Clerk
